answers.answer: See a neuro-ophthalmologist. Find one at www.aao.orgJCH MD

question: 30+ years ago I had two episodes where I lost the vision in one eye.  It was found to be a small blood vessel break, causing no permanent damage.  About 20 years ago I woke up with no vision in my right eye and my right side appeared to be paralysed.  I went back to sleep and everything was okay in the morning.  Had thorough check up.which was normal, no evidence of blood vessel breaking or leak.  Neurologist did EEG and made a diagnoisis of migraine variant.  Migraine varient was also the diagnosis for things "jumping around" on the computer screen later and I was placed on Inderal daily,  That worked.  Now for the past 6 months I have started seeing orange or sometimes yellow instead of white.  It's a nice color but when I know something was white when I go to bed, I expect it to stay white, not change to a pale orange or a bright yellow.I am diabetic, in chronic renal failure, but not on dialysis yet; heart disease, have gout, bilateral pigmentation perfusion, and a couple of other problems.  I am on Actos for the diabetes.  Should I go back to a neurologist?  My ophthalmologist said it's not my eyes.
title: Seeing inappropriate colors
